actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To provide that an individual convicted of murder in connection with any death shall not be entitled by reason of such death to health insurance under the continuation of coverage requirements applicable to group health plans.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, and the Public Health Service Act to prohibit any qualified beneficiary who is convicted of or pleads guilty to murder from being entitled, as a result of that death, to elect continuation coverage under a group health plan.

titles.title: To provide that an individual convicted of murder in connection with any death shall not be entitled by reason of such death to health insurance under the continuation of coverage requirements applicable to group health plans.
